description:
doc: go1.tmpl package change html->exp/html
I found this can not be go fix. Maybe someone could build the gofix
rule.

messages.text:
On 2012/02/28 17:10:03, minux wrote:
> On Wed, Feb 29, 2012 at 12:23 AM, <mailto:dlin.tw@gmail.com> wrote:
> >
> > Affected files:
> >  M doc/go1.html
> >
> Because change doc/go1.tmpl instead, and do a make in doc/ directory, then
Sorry, s/Because/Please/

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg//go

On Wed, Feb 29, 2012 at 12:23 AM, <dlin.tw@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> Description:
> doc: go1.html package change html->exp/html
> I found this can not be go fix. I don't know is it safe to replace
> all html.* -> exp/html.*.  But, in my old parsing html5 code, it works.
>
Because two functions (EscapeString and UnescapeString) still remain in
html package,
so there is no go fix right now (this is *only* my guess).

>
> Affected files:
>  M doc/go1.html
>
Because change doc/go1.tmpl instead, and do a make in doc/ directory, then
resubmit this CL
with changes in both doc/go1.tmpl and doc/go1.html.

Also, please give some explanation about the remaining html packages.
See http://codereview.appspot.com/5571059 for details.

subject: code review 5702046: doc: go1.html package change html->exp/html
